string.text: Bandage

An elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent the infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (adhesive plaster)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate bleeding control
Vinca

An artificial equivalent of vitamin K, also known as Vikasolum. Its main function is to increase blood coagulation speed. In great demand among stalkers who want slow-healing wounds and lacerations inflicted by mutants to close up faster. Its effects are long-lasting and can be used in situations with high risk of injury.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medicine
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate bleeding control
Anabiotics

An experimental drug developed by Professor Ozersky for scientific research teams working in the Zone. At its core, the drug contains tetrodotoxin, known colloquially as "zombie powder," which causes a complete shutdown of the body's central nervous system that may allow people to survive emissions outside cover. After six years worth of field tests, thoughtful stalkers know to keep a few on hand for unexpected blowouts.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medicine
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] zone-produced
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] causes temporary blackout
IP2 Antitoxin

An experimental substance comprising of several antidotes, including metoclopramidum, pyridoxine, thiamine, riboxin and other compounds. The drug is used to inject a range of antibiotics to neutralize natural poisons, together with synthetic poison absorbers, into the bloodstream. Antitoxins are not commonly used in the Zone as most stalkers rely on more expensive situation-appropriate protective equipment like hazard protection suits with dedicated oxygen supply. However, IP2 is used for scenarios with only brief expected exposure, as augmentation to worn protective gear, and in expeditions with limites supplies or funds. Side effects include nausea, dry mouth, and skin irritability.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medicine
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate toxin resistance
Tourniquet

A haemostatic rubber tourniquet, used to stop arterial bleeding. The tourniquet is applied to the limb above the wound, and tightened until the bleeding stops, then secured in place. An applied tourniquet should be removed after 15-20 minutes to prevent tissue necrosis.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] major bleeding control
Yadylin

A strong nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) for managing varying levels of pain. Yadulin features quick onset analgesic effects, an increased production of adrenaline in the body, and blocks enzymes responsible for inflammation and swelling. Has frequent side effects of nausea. A common pain relief drug in the Zone, though arguably more popular for its versatility in the synthesis of other compounds.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medicine
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effects
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2]causes nausea
First Aid Kit

An AI-2 individual first aid kit (Аптечка Индивидуальная) with various civilian-grade items for treating wounds, pain, and low levels of radiation exposure. The kit was developed as a standard service first aid kit for various defence and law enforcement agencies and civil defense forces of the USSR. Some of the original components may have been swapped out for modern analogs for its distribution and use in the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] slow usage (field kit)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor bleeding control
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor radiation treatment
Military Medkit

A specialized first aid kit for use by military combatants. The kit contains blood coagulants, painkillers, antibiotics, immunostimulants, and radiation-countering substances. It also includes a single-use kit for removing bullets and other foreign fragments from the body. Primarily issued to military personnel and their associates, commonly imported via offical supply routes.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] slow usage (field kit)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] major health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate bleeding control
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor radiation treatment
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Expeditionary Medkit

A specialized first aid kit developed and used by research personnel in the Zone. The kit contains blood coagulants, painkillers, antibiotics, immunostimulants, and is additionally stocked with experimental substances to counter minor to moderate radiation poisoning. It also includes a single-use kit for removing bullets and other foreign fragments from the body. The item is based off parts from available military medkits but adds neuroprotectives and compounds to flush absorbed radiation.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] slow usage (field kit)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] major health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate bleeding control
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate radiation treatment
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Ibuprofen

Common analgesic medication in the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) class used for treating minor to moderate pain. Ibuprofen works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, chemicals that promote inflammation, pain, and fever in the body, it is fast-acting, well tolerated, and cheap. Commonly used to treat minor injuries and headaches.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medicine
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Stimpack

An injectable stimulant delivery package for use in the field. Contains a composition of agents with analgetic and analeptic effects. This type of stimpack is produced directly by factions in the Zone with an unknown blend of imported and synthesized substances and questionable purity. Frequent side effects include headaches, paraesthesia, and considerable increase in nutritional demand. Popular medical item used among novices due to its low price compared to imported medical supplies and wide availability.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] zone-produced
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Military Stimpack

A military-grade injectable stimulant delivery package for use by combatants in the field. Contains a composition of potent agents with analgetic and analeptic effects. This type of stimpack is widely distributed to military personnel operating in the Zone and imported from outside pharmaceutical suppliers. Designed as an emergency measure in life-threatening situations. Its side effects include nausea, headaches and an increase in nutritional demand.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] major health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Expeditionary Stimpack

An injectable stimulant delivery package for use by research personnel in the field. It contains a composition of potent agents with analgetic, analeptic, and radiation-countering effects. This type of stimpack is commonly used by researchers and their associates, specifically designed for high-risk expeditions into the Zone. Developed by one of Kiev's defence research institutes in a line-up of other gear and equipment for exclusion zone research. Its chemical blend has a lower side effects profile than other packages, slight nausea, headaches, and increased nutritional demand may occur. The item is based off parts from available military medkits but adds neuroprotectives and compounds to flush absorbed radiation.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] major health recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb recovery
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate radiation treatment
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Cocaine

A tropane alkaloid acting as a powerful central nervous system stimulant with euphoric effects and heightened energy levels and wakefulness. The duration of its effects depend on the mode of administration and substance purity. Common side effects include anxiety, paranoia, and restlessness. Used both recreationally and practically in the field to counter drowsiness. Some factions openly distribute it among their members while use in the Zone in general is not overly common.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate stimulant
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Epinephrine Shot

A shot containing Epinephrine (also known as adrenalin), a hormone and a neurotransmitter. When released in the body, it acts rapidly in regulating heart rate, blood vessel and air passage diameters, metabolic shifts, and triggers instant energy production within cells throughout the body. Medically, epinephrine is used to treat anaphylaxis, cardiac arrest, and superficial bleeding. In the field, Epinephrine can be used as an emergency stimulant to counteract drowsiness and fatigue.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] major stimulant
Morphine Shot

An iron ampoule containing morphine, designed as field equipment for military field personnel. Morphine is regarded as the gold standard of opioid analgesics, used to relieve acute pain levels. Like other opioids, such as oxycodone, hydromorphone, and diacetylmorphine (heroin), morphine acts directly on the central nervous system (CNS). Serious side effects include nausea, low blood pressure, and increased nutritional demand after comedown. Morphine is stocked by medical personnel in the Zone and often carried as emergency relief for severe physical injuries.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]minor bleeding control
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]major limb triage
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]major analgesic effect
Metamizole Shot

An iron ampoule containing a combination of metamizole and an antihemorrhagic agent, designed as field equipment for military field personnel. Metamizole is a strong non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), effective in treating moderate to intense pain and fever. Side effects include nausea, weakness, increased nutritional demand, and delayed onset leukopenia and agranulocytosis. The substance blend is often stocked by military personnel in the Zone for use by medical staff.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]very minor bleeding control
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]moderate limb triage
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]moderate analgesic effect
Sulfadimethoxine

An effective sulfonamide antimicrobial medication used to treat infections and diseases caused by bacteria. Sulfadimethoxine is a bacteriostatic agent that works by blocking synthesis of folic acid, a key component in the production of DNA and RNA. While the drug's primary function is to act against bacteria, including E. coli, Salmonella, and Staphylococcus, it also has an observable effect against some anomalous toxins and effects of light radiation exposure. Side effects include headaches, digestive disorders, skin rashes, fevers, and leukopenia.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor radiation resistance
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor toxicity resistance
Diclofenac

A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) from the group of phenylacetic acid derivatives, commonly used as an analgetic in the treatment of mild to moderate pain, migraines, inflammation, and swelling. It features a considerable side effects profile, including headaches, dizziness, drowsiness, and rarely, memory disorders, disorientation, and general irritability. While being phased out as a common painkiller, it expired stock still made its way from warehouse clearances into the Zone and taken for the treatment of severe injuries when better alternatives can not be procured.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] very minor health recovery
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] very minor bleeding control
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate analgesic effect
Chlortetracycline

A tetracycline antibiotic with antiprotozoal and antibacterial effects. It was the first tetracycline identified and the second antibiotic agent developed after penicillin. This class of medication works by inhibiting protein synthesis in the mRNA translation complex, among other mechanisms. It is effective against a broad spectrum of bacteria, but also against viruses, and some conditions not spread by infection. It is used in the Zone to guard against specific environmental hazards, often in combination with other substances. Side effects may include nausea, phototoxicity, digestive problems, allergic reactions, and rarely, headaches.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor radiation resistance
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor toxicity resistance
Axyltallisal

An extremely potent, highly experimental regenerative drug. For its near-miraculous beneficial effects, it is informally called "Rebirth". The compound was developed by Zone researchers as part of an interdisciplinary study on triage and recovery after severe physical trauma and serious anomalous field exposure. The drug is assumed to contain volatile neurogenetics, neuroprotectants, immunotherapeutics, analeptics, and additional unknown agents; its official composition was not published. Intended to be used in a controlled and safe environment. When ingested, the patient will enter a short-lasting comatose state while the drug induces an extreme state of physical and neurological regeneration. The patient should regain consciousness after the effect naturally wears off. Side effects of repeated uses are unknown.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] experimental item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] anesthetic (unconsciousness)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major health recovery
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major radiation treatment
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major analgesic effect
Anabiotic

A highly experimental research chemical developed as a last resort for surviving direct exposure to an emission, with a drastic mode of effect and an overwhelming side effects profile. It is an unknown combination of sodium thiopental, a rapid-onset barbiturate anesthetic, and other sedatives that dramatically slow metabolic processes in the body to a state of suspended animation. A second stage nonbenzodiazepine is released on an organic fuse that lasts for the approximate duration of an emission and restores bodily function and consciousness. Even one-time use of anabiotics can have permanent adverse effects on the user, the extent of which are unknown, not including nervous system damage sustained from direct emission exposure. If no certain alternatives are available, lay down on the ground in fetal position, shielding head and torso, ingest on emission build-up, and wait for onset of sedative effects. After successful reanimation, ensure proper hydration, nutrition, and medical attention. Should not be combined with other substances.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] experimental item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] anesthetic (unconsciousness)
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] major emission survival chance
Oxycodone

A semi-synthetic opioid for the treatment of moderate to severe and persistent pain and use as a cough suppressant. This variant combines dihydrohydroxycodeinone with acetaminophen, a non-opioid analgesic, and antipyretic (a combination sold under the brand name Vicodin, Lortab, and others). The medication induces euphoria and sedation, it is commonly abused for recreational use. It has a high chance for addiction and its side effects include nausea, drowsiness, constipation, and respiratory problems in higher doses. In the field, it may be used as a painkiller after sustaining physical injuries, especially to rest and recover.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor health recovery
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate analgesic effect
Diazepam

A benzodiazepine derivative with sedative, hypnotic, and anxiolytic properties, increasing effects of the GABA neurotransmitter. It is used to treat anxiety, insomnia, seizures, and as a general sedative. While short-term use is considered reasonably safe, prolonged use carries risk of dependence and cognitive issues. Frequent side effects include nausea, drowsiness, amnesia, and confusion. In the Zone, it is used primarily as a sleeping aid to counter stress, anxiety, and sleeplessness.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate fatigue
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor antipsychotic
Etperazine

A moderately potent antipsychotic medication of the phenothiazine class with antiallergic, sedative, miorelaxing, and antiemetic effects, acting by blocking Dopamine D2 receptors in the mesocortical and mesolimbic systems. It is used in the treatment of psychosis, hallucinations, schizophrenia, mild to moderate psychomotor agitation, and as an antiemetic. In the Zone, it is used for resistance to the effects of mind-affecting hazards. Side effects include nausea, disorientation, and apathy. Prolonged exposure to cognition-affecting fields is highly discouraged, wearing properly shielding headgear is advised.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate antipsychotic
Haloperidol

A potent psychotropic medication often resold under the colloquial brand "Psy Block" for resistance to the effects of mind-affecting hazards found in the Zone. Haloperidol is a potent first generation antipsychotic used in the treatment of acute psychosis, hallucinations, hyperactive delirium, schizophrenia, severe nausea from the effects of radiation therapy, and as an antiemetic. Ingestion induces short-term alexithymia (emotional blindness) and may cause side effects of nausea, disorientation, and apathy. Prolonged exposure to cognition-affecting fields is highly discouraged, wearing properly shielding headgear is advised.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] experimental item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major antipsychotic
Surgical Instruments

Medical tools that belong to a surgical field kit for emergency procedures. The tools can either be combined with other items to make make assemble a proper kit or used as-is for emergency interventions. Without a proper surgery kit, direct use will require disinfection and bandaging.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor limb triage
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor surgical trauma
Tranexyban

An antifibrinolytic agent for treatment and prevention of major hemorrhaging and excessive menstruation. Tranexamic acid is a synthetic derivative of lysine and acts by preventing the breakdown of fibrin, allowing sustained blood clotting and control bleeding. Side effects are rare, with low chances for seizures, altered vision, and anaphylactic shock; hydration is recommended. The drug is commonly carried by medical and military personnel in the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor bleeding control
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor bleeding resistance
Military Bandage

An elastic, self-adhesive military-issue bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. It provides excellent grip, can be quickly applied in the field, and later removed without residue. The bandage is lightweight, flexible, and can be used for regular and arterial bleeding.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (adhesive)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major bleeding control
Fluorapine Shot

An military-issue injector containing a moderate metabolic stimulant and a mix of purine and pyrimidine analog cytotoxic substances. Its stimulant part acts to accelerate wound-healing processes in the body, while the cytotoxic substances aim to target and destroy damaged cells and pathogens. The drug was originally developed from pharmaceutical anti-cancer trials and selected for military use for its effect on trauma recovery times. It is used to triage physical injuries in the field when proper medical care can not be provided. Side effects include chest pain, fever, bleeding, and increased nutritional demand.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor health recovery
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor bleeding resistance
SJ-I Combat Stimulant Shot

A military-issue stimulant to increase physical capabilities, alertness, and cognitive performance, intended for use in combat scenarios. It contains part epinephrine, part pipradrol, a mild central nervous system stimulant and NDRI, and part metamizole, an ampyrone sulfonate group compound with analgesic and antipyretic effects. In combination, the shot provides an acute boost to physical and psychological resilience, even in high stress environments. Side effects are generally lower than other combat stimulant pens and may include insomnia, tachycardia, anxiety, and rarely hypertension, euphoria, depression, psychosis, and others. SJ-I is distributed, usually as a pen injector, to military personnel set to perform under extreme conditions for longer periods of time. Among the SJ class pens, it is well tolerated and has fewer adverse effects.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate stimulant effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate analgesic effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor antipsychotic effects
SJ-V Combat Stimulant Shot

A military-issue stimulant to increase physical capabilities, alertness, and cognitive performance, intended for use in combat scenarios. It contains part epinephrine, part amfepramone, an amphetamine class psychostimulant, and part metamizole, an ampyrone sulfonate group compound with analgesic and antipyretic effects. In combination, the shot provides an acute boost to physical and psychological resilience, even in high stress environments, as well as mild to moderate euphoric effects. Side effects include hyperactivity, sweating, teeth grinding, hypertension, hypotension, irregular heartbeat, nausea, weight loss, and others. SJ-V is distributed, usually as a pen injector, to military personnel set to perform under extreme conditions for longer periods of time. Among the SJ class pens, it is decently tolerated and has acceptable adverse effects compared to its significant desired effects.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major stimulant effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate analgesic effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor antipsychotic effects
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor hallucinogenic effects
SJ-IX Combat Stimulant Shot

A military-issue stimulant to increase physical capabilities, alertness, and cognitive performance, intended for use in combat scenarios. It contains part epinephrine, part methamphetamine racetame, a potent central nervous system stimulant, and part metamizole, an ampyrone sulfonate group compound with analgesic and antipyretic effects. In combination, the shot provides an acute boost to physical and psychological resilience, even in high stress environments, as well as mild to moderate euphoric effects. Side effects include hyperactivity, sweating, teeth grinding, hypertension, hypotension, irregular heartbeat, nausea, weight loss, and others. SJ-IX is distributed in limited quantities, usually as a pen injector, to military personnel set to perform under extreme conditions for longer periods of time. Among the SJ class pens, it is decently tolerated but also has notable adverse effects and a moderate addiction and abuse profile.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] military item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (injector)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] major stimulant effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate analgesic effects
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor antipsychotic effects
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor hallucinogenic effects
Surgical Field Kit

A portable kit that provides medical instruments and supplies to perform minor surgical operations and suturing in the field. It includes a stainless steel scalpel, tweezers, scissors, needle holder, various kinds of wipes, as well as sterile suturing material made from nylon and bandage tape. The kit is designed for use by trained medical professionals for severe injuries and wounds that require immediate attention when a proper field hospital or care facility is not available.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] high quality
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] slow usage (field kit)

Paracetamol

An acetaminophen class antipyretic medication used to treat mild to moderate pain and fever. Paracetamol is an inexpensive over-the-counter drug, it is well tolerated and has a notably low side effects profile with rare cases of nausea, skin rashes, and liver damage when ingested in high doses. In the Zone, it is primarily stocked and used by medical personnel.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] medical item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] minor analgesic effect
Modafinil

An eugeroic stimulant that promotes wakefulness and heightened cognition, usually prescriped for the treatment of narcolepsy and excessive daytime fatigue. It is sometimes also prescribed off-label for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) with mixed efficacy and in adjunctive (combination therapy) treatment of bipolar disorder. Historically, Modafinil has been distributed to military personnel for fatigue management as a safer alternative to amphetamines and to ISS-stationed astronauts to manage circadian dyssynchrony. In the field, it is a viable option to induce alertness and cognitive enhancement with a low side effects and addiction profile.

Synthetic Splint

A lightweight splint for immobilizing and stabilizing fractures, sprains, and other injuries, made from synthetic materials and a number of velcro straps to secure it. It is designed to be easily applied and removed, and can be used to support and protect injured limbs.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:

 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] imported item
 %c[d_blue] • %c[ui_gray_2] fast usage (velcro straps)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] moderate limb triage
SAM Splint

A compact, lightweight, and versatile splint for immobilizing and stabilizing fractures, sprains, and other injuries. The SAM Splint is made of a thin core of aluminum alloy, sandwiched between two layers of closed-cell foam. It can be bent into any of three simple curves, becoming extremely strong and supportive for any fractured or injured limb. The splint is durable, waterproof, and radiolucent. It is widely carried in the Zone to treat damage to arms and legs.
